description: A stout wooden pole sharpened on one end, all formed from a single piece of wood, with twists and curves like it grew in place rather than being made.
A giant spear over three meters long, all formed from a single piece of wood, with twists and curves like it grew in place rather than being made.
A weapon with a long wooden handle connected to a knobby wooden head, all formed from a single piece of wood, with twists and curves like it grew in place rather than being made.
A sturdy staff all formed from a single piece of wood, with twists and curves like it grew in place rather than being carved.
A long hammer with a spike on one end, all formed from a single piece of wood, with twists and curves like it grew in place rather than being carved.

A sturdy polearm with a curved blade, all formed from a single piece of wood, with twists and curves like it grew in place rather than being carved.  You're not sure how long it will hold its edge, but it's surprisingly sharp.

A large knife, all formed from a single piece of wood, with twists and curves like it grew in place rather than being carved.  You're not sure how long it will hold its edge, but it's surprisingly sharp.
